intro: Dischidia cominsii, commonly known as the ivy-leaf fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is a climbing or trailing plant characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and is native to Southeast Asia. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Dischidia cominsii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
